content.description: Make delicate moves on steep friction to a narrow mantle shelf above a small bulge (crux). Clip a bolt and continue up easier slab, passing small gear in the vertical cracks on your left.  Climb to a tree ledge directly above with gear under a small overlap.  Clip a bolt on the next face above the tree ledge and either climb the face to a two-bolt anchor or step left for a slightly easier romp up the arete to the anchor.  There is a bolt half way up this face that can be used to protect either variation.This anchor is well placed for top rope laps with a 60 m rope.Note: With crux moves off the ground, a stick clip could come in handy for the first bolt.*FA party intends to continue the adventure upwards from this anchor and will post an update when applicable.
content.protection: 3 bolts and small gear.  There's a bomber placement for a 00.  Good placement for an offset #3 if you have it, but not really necessary.
content.location: About 20 minutes past the great corner along the approach trail.  If you reach Ethan's Delight, you've gone about 100' too far.

content.description: Sun morning until mid to late afternoon.
